description: Galle and Bentota Day-Tour From Colombo
include: Hotel pickup and drop-off in a shared vehicle
exclude: Madu River boat safari ($30 for solo travelers, $25 per person if 2 or more travelers)

experience.heading: Madu River
experience.text: Photo stop, Boat riding, Guided tour, Sightseeing,  (3 hours)

fullDescriptionParas: After being picked up at your hotel, hop onboard your Madu Ganga Magrove boat safari and explore the Madu River. See the mangrove forests and marshlands that surround the river. Stop at a cinnamon garden, and try some of the areaâ€™s famous cinnamon. The Madu Ganga River region is home to some of the best quality cinnamon in the world as well as a flourishing cinnamon industry. Afterward, marvel at the fishermen who stoically sit atop large branches planted in the middle of the water waiting for their catch.

Continue to a local Turtle Hatchery, where your guide will introduce you to the many local varieties of turtles. End your tour with a visit to the Galle Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. This fort illustrates the unique interaction of European architecture and South Asian traditions from the 16th to the 19th centuries. After discovering the fort, you will be returned to your hotel in Colombo

description: From Colombo : Day Trip to Kandy | Pinnwala | Royal Gardens
include: Complimentary pickup and drop-off ( Colombo, Dehiwala, Kadawatha, Gampaha, Kandy )
Travel comfortably in a luxury, air-conditioned car
exclude: Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic (about 6 $)
fullDescriptionParas: Experience the vibrant culture and natural beauty of Sri Lanka on this captivating tour from Colombo to Kandy. Your journey begins with a visit to the Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage, where you can observe and interact with orphaned elephants as they bathe and play in the river. This heartwarming experience offers a glimpse into the conservation efforts dedicated to protecting these magnificent creatures

Continue to the Temple of the Tooth in Kandy, a sacred Buddhist site that houses the relic of the tooth of the Buddha. Marvel at the intricate architecture and experience the spiritual atmosphere of this revered temple.

Next, immerse yourself in the tranquility of the Royal Botanical Gardens in Peradeniya. Explore the vast collection of plants, including orchids, palms, and medicinal plants, while enjoying the peaceful ambiance of this botanical paradise.

Afterwards, embark on a spice walk in Kandy, where you'll learn about the spices that are integral to Sri Lankan cuisine. Engage your senses as you smell and taste a variety of spices, gaining insight into their flavors and uses.
Conclude your tour with a visit to a tea factory, where you'll learn about the process of tea production from leaf to cup. Discover the art of tea making and sample some of the finest Ceylon tea

Finally, make your way to Kandy View Point, where you'll be rewarded with panoramic views of the city and its picturesque surroundings. Capture the breathtaking scenery and create lasting memories of your journey through Sri Lanka.
The tour will conclude with drop-off at the same location in Colombo where you were picked up.

description: From Colombo : Sigiriya and Dambulla Day Trip and Safari
include: Guide Assistance in Sigiriya Lion Rock (English, German, French, Spanish)
exclude: Optional National Park Jeep safari (1 person $ 100/02 person or more $50 per person)

experience.heading: Dambulla Royal Cave Temple and Golden Temple
experience.text: Visit, Sightseeing, Walk, Self-guided tour (1 hour)

fullDescriptionParas: Depart Colombo and travel by a shared vehicle, in a small group, to the city of Sigiriya, and head directly to Sigiriya Rock on arrival. Gaze in awe at the massive column of rock that, according to the ancient Sri Lankan chronicle The Culavamsa, was selected by King Kassyapa as the site of his new capital.

Admire numerous paintings of historic queens, princesses, and maids inside the rock fortress before getting a break for lunch at your own expense. Then, explore some of the traditional crafts of the region, such as wood carving and batik textiles, with time to purchase souvenirs before departing.

Start the journey back towards Colombo via Dambulla to explore the largest and best-preserved cave temple complex in Sri Lanka. Discover the magnificent Buddha images and rock paintings of vivid colors and different shapes, painted from around the 2nd century B.C. up to the 18th-century Kandyan era
Optionally Can be done the Wild Life Safari at Eco Park or Kaudulla National Park or Minneriya National park charges for National Park very on Pax Count ( For solo Passengers $ 100 & $ 60 )

description: From Colombo : Galle and Bentota Day Tour
include: Hotel pickup and drop-off in Colombo, Dehiwala, Mount Lavinia, Kalutara,Bentota, Beruwala, Kosgoda, Ahungalla, and Balapitiya area
exclude: Madu river boat safari (Solo traveler is 30 USD per person. Two or more travellers are 25 USD per person)
Turtle Hatchery Ticket (15 USD per person)
fullDescriptionParas: Start your day with a convenient pickup from your hotel. Hop aboard your comfortable tour vehicle and experience the wonders of Sri Lanka's Madu Ganga River Region with a thrilling boat safari. Witness the beauty of mangrove forests and marshlands as you sail through the Madu River. Discover the secrets of cinnamon at a local garden and taste the renowned spice.
Be captivated by skilled fishermen perched on branches, patiently waiting for their catch. At the Turtle Hatchery, meet various turtle species and learn about their conservation efforts.

The tour concludes with a visit to the UNESCO-listed Galle Fort, a remarkable blend of European and South Asian architecture spanning centuries. After this unforgettable journey, you'll be safely returned to your Colombo hotel. Don't miss this opportunity to immerse yourself in nature, culture, and history.

description: From Colombo | Negambo : Sigiriya, Dambulla and Minneriya Day Trip
include: Air-conditioned Vehicle with English Speaking Driver
Parking fees and other transport-related expenses
exclude: Entry ticket to all places and activities

experience.heading: Dambulla Royal Cave Temple and Golden Temple

fullDescriptionParas: Explore the Sigiriya Lion Rock Fortress and Minneriya National Park on a day trip from Colombo. Visit the Hiriwadunna Village and enjoy a Sri Lankan buffet, take a jeep safari in Minneriya National Park, and visit the Dambulla Cave Temple.

Start your day with a visit to the Sigiriya Lion Rock Fortress, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and the 8th Wonder of the World. Climb to the top of the rock and admire the panoramic views of the surrounding area

Next, visit the Hiriwadunna Village and enjoy a Sri Lankan buffet. Take a village safari, starting with a bull cart ride, then go to the lake for a catamaran ride, and finally go to a village home. Enjoy a Sri Lankan rice and curry meal with a small cookery demonstration.
After lunch, head to Minneriya National Park for a 4-hour jeep safari. See herds of elephants as they walk 35 km every day. During the season, visit the Hurulu Eco Park near Minneriya.
On your way back to Colombo, stop at the historical Dambulla Cave Temple and Golden Temple.

description: Private Sigiriya and Dambulla Day Tour from Colombo
include: Transportation in an air-conditioned Private vehicle (car/van/bus)
Guide Assistance in Sigiriya Lion Rock (English, German, French, Spanish)

experience.heading: Dambulla Royal Cave Temple and Golden Temple
Sigiriya Lion Rock
experience.text: Visit, Guided tour, Sightseeing, Walk (2 hours)

experience.heading: Sigiriya
experience.text: Visit, Lunch, Walk, Local snacks, Self-guided tour, Regional food (1.5 hours)

fullDescriptionParas: Depart Colombo and travel by a Private vehicle, to the city of Sigiriya, and head directly to Sigiriya Rock on arrival. Gaze in awe at the massive column of rock that, according to the ancient Sri Lankan chronicle The Culavamsa, was selected by King Kassyapa as the site of his new capital.

Admire numerous paintings of historic queens, princesses, and maids inside the rock fortress before getting a break for lunch at your own expense. Then, explore some of the traditional crafts of the region, such as wood carving and batik textiles, with time to purchase souvenirs before departing.

Start the journey back towards Colombo via Dambulla to explore the largest and best-preserved cave temple complex in Sri Lanka. Discover the magnificent Buddha images and rock paintings of vivid colors and different shapes, painted from around the 2nd century B.C. up to the 18th-century Kandyan era.
Optionally Can be done the Wild Life Safari at Eco Park or Kaudulla National Park or Minneriya National park charges for National Park very on Pax Count ( For solo Passengers $ 100 & $ 60 )

description: Colombo: Galle and Bentota Day Trip From Colombo City
include: Visit to a local Turtle Hatchery
fullDescriptionParas: Discover the Madu Ganga River on a boat safari from Colombo. See the mangrove forests and marshlands that surround the river. Stop at a cinnamon garden, and try some of the areaâ€™s famous cinnamon. Visit a local turtle hatchery and the Galle Fort.

After being picked up at your hotel, hop onboard your Madu Ganga Magrove boat safari and explore the Madu River. See the mangrove forests and marshlands that surround the river. Stop at a cinnamon garden, and try some of the areaâ€™s famous cinnamon. The Madu Ganga River region is home to some of the best quality cinnamon in the world as well as a flourishing cinnamon industry.

Afterward, marvel at the fishermen who stoically sit atop large branches planted in the middle of the water waiting for their catch. Continue to a local Turtle Hatchery, where your guide will introduce you to the many local varieties of turtles.

End your tour with a visit to the Galle Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. This fort illustrates the unique interaction of European architecture and South Asian traditions from the 16th to the 19th centuries. After discovering the fort, you will be returned to your hotel in Colombo.

Start your 6-hour city tour of Colombo with a visit to the famous Bandaranaike Memorial International Conference Hall (BMICH), which is renowned for its opulent architecture. Explore Independence Square, a representation of Sri Lankan independence, next.

After learning about the island's lengthy history at the Colombo Museum, visit Gangarama Temple, a tranquil oasis in the middle of the busy city. The Lotus Tower, which provides sweeping city views, is not to be missed.
Discover the colorful mayhem of Pettah Market and neighborhood bazaarsâ€”a sensory extravaganza. Admire the magnificent Fort Railway Station and the historic Colombo Lighthouse.

Galle Face Green is a waterfront promenade that's ideal for relaxing. Following lunch, continue your journey with stops at Ponambalam Vaneswarar Temple and St. Anthony's Shrine, both of which provide insightful looks into local culture.
Enjoy the memories as your tour comes to an end and you are driven back to your hotel, enhanced by the beauty and diversity of Colombo.
